CHANGING THE ACCOUNT MAIL FOR PRODUCTION:
CHANGING THE ACCOUNT MAIL FOR PRODUCTION AND COMMERCIAL
Launch the PUTTY
              Enter the hostname/IP address of the server and click Open.
              When prompted, enter your username and password to log in.
             After logging in, run the following command to switch to the sas user
             su – sas
Connect to mdb with con 706 cn
Run the SELECT query and check previous data
select * from mdb_config
where key_name in ('production_account_mail', 'commercial_account_mail')
check the output if new mail and old mail is same, then no need to do any changes.
If the output and new mail is different we need to change.
Add new email and airline code in the script.
Now Change directory using 
Cd Anand fargose 
ls -ltr (now we can see the ‘add_prod_email’)
we can change to this directory using 
cd add_prod_email
now create new directory with qms no to identify easily.
Mkdir qms no
Cd qms no
Create new script file
Cat > script.sh
Enter the script 
rm -rf $0_traza $0_bds
echo "
unload to $0_bds delimiter ' '
  select unique trim(dbname)||'@'||trim(dbserver) db from cdb_connection
      where afv_daily_enviroment='N'
      and upper(business_id) not like '%TEST%'
         and airline_code in ('180')
">$0_crear.sql
dbaccess cdb_support@afv2tcp_repr $0_crear.sql
while read a
do
        echo $a >>$0_traza
echo "
update mdb_config set key_value='joyce.furtado@accelya.com'
where key_name='production_account_mail';
update mdb_config set key_value='joyce.furtado@accelya.com'
where key_name='commercial_account_mail';
">$0_loadmdb.sql
        dbaccess $a $0_loadmdb.sql 2>>$0_traza
rm -rf $0_loadmdb.sql
done<$0_bds
#mutt -s "replace_email_047" anand.fargose@accelya.com -a $0_traza <$0_traza
rm -rf $0_crear.sql
enter (ctrl + d)
Give execute permission
chmod +x script.sh
Run the script in the background
Nohup  ./script.sh &
Check if the script is running 
Jobs
To view the output check output file 
Cat nohup.out
BAED RECALULATION:
BAED RECALULATION
Launch PuTTY on your machine.
Connect to the host (vlrdpc26) 
Log in with your credentials (username/password or key).
Connect to MDB (con 957 BR)
Before making any changes, you need to check the current BAED. By using this query.
select std_non_modify.trnn,std_non_modify.document,std_non_modify.id_file,
std_non_modify.baed
from
std_non_modify, hot_bkt06, special_data
where
std_non_modify.id_file=hot_bkt06.id_file
and std_non_modify.baed=hot_bkt06.baed
and std_non_modify.trnn=hot_bkt06.trnn
and std_non_modify.id_file=special_data.id_file
and std_non_modify.baed=special_data.baed
and std_non_modify.trnn=special_data.trnn
and special_data.verification_level=1
--and in_scope='Y'
and transaction_code in ('TKTT')
and std_non_modify.document in(
'1001536532')
Run the SELECT query. You need to replace document_number and transaction_code with values from QMS. Run this query.
set isolation to dirty read;
select std_non_modify.trnn,std_non_modify.document,std_non_modify.id_file,
std_non_modify.baed
from
std_non_modify, hot_bkt06, special_data
where
std_non_modify.id_file=hot_bkt06.id_file
and std_non_modify.baed=hot_bkt06.baed
and std_non_modify.trnn=hot_bkt06.trnn
and std_non_modify.id_file=special_data.id_file
and std_non_modify.baed=special_data.baed
and std_non_modify.trnn=special_data.trnn
and special_data.verification_level=1
--and in_scope='Y'
and transaction_code in ('TKTT')
and std_non_modify.document in(
'1001536532',
)
into temp supp_anand_temp
Run INSERT Query. It will show the output number of rows are inserted.
insert into recalc_baed_log (id_file, trnn, baed)
           select snm.id_file, snm.trnn, snm.baed 
           from std_non_modify snm, supp_anand_temp ot, special_data sd
           where snm.trnn = ot.trnn
           --and sd.real_status_final != 5
           and sd.verification_level = 1
           and sd.id_process is null
           and snm.id_file = sd.id_file
           and snm.trnn = sd.trnn
           and snm.baed = sd.baed
           --and in_scope='Y'
           and transaction_code in ('TKTT')
Output: -
(0) rows inserted
→ Something is wrong. No data was inserted.
(1) rows inserted
→ Data insertion successful.
After successful insertion. Exit the MDB session
Now you need to run the Cambiar script and make changes out side the mdb.
Modify these parameters:
MDB Account Name
BAED value (as per QMS)
cambiar_baed_2021.sh db name and date
After Cambiar completes successfully. Reconnect to MDB. (con 957 BR)
Now insert the final BAED update using the updated values from QMS.
Modify and run the same INSERT query with the final BAED values.
Again, check that rows are inserted successfully.
set isolation to dirty read;
insert into hot_bch02
select unique id_file  ,  pdai   ,pcyc, '11/25/2024', dyri,  resd , linea from hot_bch02
where id_file in  (select unique id_file from recalc_baed_log where baed_new ='20241125')
and id_file not in (select bbb.id_file from hot_bch02 bbb  where bbb.baed='11/25/2024')
verify that the BAED has been updated correctly by using select query.
